ResearchTabDef.label: Mechadendrites Research
ResearchTabDef.generalDescription: Develop mechadendrites and how to implant them by researching at a research bench. You can only have one active project at a time.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Spinal Cord Attachement
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop and refine methods for attaching new tendril-like limbs onto a person's back and grant control over them via attaching to the spinal cord

ResearchProjectDef.label: Basic Mechadendrite machining
ResearchProjectDef.description: Innovating upon the groundwork of attaching new body parts onto your colonists, create the basics of "Mechadendrites". Small, simplistic tendril-like limbs wired into peoples' spinal cords to grant neurological control over them. These initial designs are rudimentary and lead into rigid tendrils that cannot flow smoothly limiting potential.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Refined Mechadendrite replacements
ResearchProjectDef.description: First iterations of Mechadendrites showed promise but are too rigid for most use. Expand upon your initial designs by using more flexible materials in the construction of newer refined mechadendrites acting as small iterative improvements on baseic mechadendrites and the expansion into specialised mechadendrites.
